section.title: Law 1
section.para:
The months of the year are lunar months, as it is said: "... the burnt offering of the month in its month"
Bamidbar 28:14 and "This month shall be for you the head of the months"
Shemos 12:2 : "The Holy One, blessed be He, showed to Moshe, in a prophetic vision, the image of the moon, and said: "When you see the moon like this, sanctify it.""
Rosh Hashanah 20b; Menachot 29a

But the years that we reckon sre the solar years, as it is said: "Keep the month of spring".
Dvarim 16

section.title: Law 2
section.para:
How much longer is the solar year than the lunar year? By approximately 11 days. Therefore, when this excess accumulates to around a month, or a little less, or a little more, a month is added and the year is made to have 13 months (this is called a full year), since it is impossible to have a year of 12 months and some days, as it is said: "... for the months of the year" - you count the months of the year, but not the days of the year.
Megilla 5a; Nazir 7a
